descriptions: Student does not demonstrate an understanding of any factors contributing to individual uniqueness.
Student identifies one or two basic factors (e.g., appearance) but lacks depth in explanation.
Student identifies several factors (e.g., appearance, interests) but descriptions are superficial.
Student describes multiple factors (e.g., appearance, interests, personality) with some explanation of how they contribute to uniqueness.
Student thoroughly describes various factors (e.g., genetics, environment, experiences, personality) and explains how they interact to shape individual uniqueness.

Student provides an insightful and comprehensive analysis of the complex interplay of factors (genetics, environment, experiences, personality, values) that contribute to individual uniqueness, demonstrating a nuanced understanding.
Explanation is unclear and contains inaccuracies.
Explanation is somewhat unclear and contains several inaccuracies.
Explanation is generally clear but may contain a few minor inaccuracies.
Explanation is clear and mostly accurate, with only minor errors.
Explanation is clear, accurate, and well-organized.
Explanation is exceptionally clear, accurate, well-organized, and demonstrates a sophisticated understanding of the concepts.
Provides one irrelevant or unclear example.
Provides one basic example that is somewhat relevant.
Provides several relevant examples that support the explanation.
Provides detailed and relevant examples that clearly illustrate the factors of uniqueness.
Provides insightful and diverse examples that demonstrate a deep understanding of how various factors shape individual uniqueness.
